flu.advice: You may have flu. Take rest, drink plenty of fluids, and consult a doctor if fever persists beyond 3 days.

cold.advice: You may have a common cold. Stay hydrated, take steam inhalation, and rest well.

allergy.advice: You may be experiencing an allergy. Avoid known triggers and consider antihistamines after consulting a doctor.

migraine.advice: You may have a migraine. Rest in a dark room, stay hydrated, and avoid bright lights or loud noises.

covid.advice: You may have COVID-19. Self-isolate, wear a mask, and get tested immediately.

asthma.advice: You may have asthma. Avoid dust and smoke, and use prescribed inhalers regularly.

bronchitis.advice: You may have bronchitis. Rest, drink warm fluids, and consult a doctor for antibiotics if needed.

sinusitis.advice: You may have sinusitis. Try steam inhalation, stay hydrated, and consult a doctor if symptoms persist.

diabetes.advice: Possible diabetes. Check your blood sugar levels and consult an endocrinologist.

hypertension.advice: You may have high blood pressure. Reduce salt intake, exercise, and monitor your BP regularly.

depression.advice: You may be experiencing depression. Talk to a counselor or therapist for professional support.

anxiety.advice: You may have anxiety. Practice deep breathing and relaxation exercises; consult a psychologist if persistent.

food_poisoning.advice: You may have food poisoning. Drink oral rehydration solution (ORS) and avoid solid food until recovery.

ulcer.advice: You may have a stomach ulcer. Avoid spicy foods and consult a gastroenterologist.

malaria.advice: You may have malaria. Get a blood test done immediately and consult a doctor for antimalarial treatment.

dengue.advice: You may have dengue fever. Stay hydrated, avoid painkillers like aspirin, and seek medical care.

thyroid.advice: You may have a thyroid imbalance. Get a thyroid function test and consult an endocrinologist.

chickenpox.advice: You may have chickenpox. Avoid scratching, rest well, and consult a doctor for antiviral medication.

urinary_tract_infection.advice: You may have a urinary tract infection. Drink plenty of water and consult a doctor for antibiotics.

pneumonia.advice: You may have pneumonia. Seek immediate medical attention for antibiotics or hospitalization.

arthritis.advice: You may have arthritis. Gentle exercises and anti-inflammatory medication can help, but consult a doctor.

dehydration.advice: You may be dehydrated. Drink water or ORS frequently and rest.

heat_stroke.advice: Possible heat stroke. Move to a cool place, drink fluids, and seek medical help immediately.
